001package com.github.sormuras.bach.command;
002
003import com.github.sormuras.bach.Command;
004
005/**
006 * The jpackage command creates self-contained Java applications.
007 *
008 * <p>The jpackage tool will take as input a Java application and a Java run-time image, and produce
009 * a Java application image that includes all the necessary dependencies. It will be able to produce
010 * a native package in a platform-specific format, such as an exe on Windows or a dmg on macOS. Each
011 * format must be built on the platform it runs on, there is no cross-platform support. The tool
012 * will have options that allow packaged applications to be customized in various ways.
013 *
014 * @see <a
015 *     href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/16/docs/specs/man/jpackage.html">jpackage</a>
016 */
017public record JPackageCommand(AdditionalArgumentsOption additionals)
018    implements Command<JPackageCommand> {
019  public JPackageCommand() {
020    this(AdditionalArgumentsOption.empty());
021  }
022
023  @Override
024  public String name() {
025    return "jmod";
026  }
027
028  @Override
029  public JPackageCommand additionals(AdditionalArgumentsOption additionals) {
030    return new JPackageCommand(additionals);
031  }
032}
